content: NEW YORK  Sept 8 Two Beijing residents agreed to pay nearly $2.77 million to resolve a U.S. regulator's charges that their "remarkably timed" purchase of options in Chinese e-commerce company 58.com Inc stemmed from insider trading  according to court papers.
name: 58com Inc
title: Chinese citizens in $2.8 million insider trading deal with SEC

content: April 29 Two Chinese nationals were accused by the U.S. Securities Exchange Commission of insider trading in Chinese classified advertising website 58.com Inc  through their "remarkably timed" purchases of call options.
name: 58com Inc
title: SEC accuses Chinese nationals of insider trading in 58.com

content: BEIJING Chinese classified advertising site 58.com Inc  said on Friday that it had agreed to buy a 43.2 percent stake in rival Ganji.com  marking further consolidation in the mainland's hot technology sector.
name: 58com Inc
title: Chinese classified ad site 58.com to buy 43 percent of rival Ganji

content: BEIJING  April 17 Chinese classified advertising site 58.com Inc said on Friday that it had agreed to buy a 43.2 percent stake in rival Ganji.com  marking further consolidation in the mainland's hot technology sector.
name: 58com Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Chinese classified ad site 58.com to buy 43 pct of rival Ganji
